result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah L Birth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah L Birth

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: CAA bill
Attorney fees in the amount of $774.54 for Attorney Melissa Petersen

9:58 AM Defendant Jeremiah L Birth in court.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Jeremiah L Birth.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 3: Disorderly Conduct as a Domestic and Count 4: Criminal Damage to Property as a Domestic. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders court costs and surcharges and DNA sample and surcharge. Anything else in this file is ordered dismissed and read in. 1 day of jail credit noted.

No acts or threats of violence against anyone. 
Defendant to leave if J.B. tells him to leave.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to leave if J.B. tells him to leave.

10:05 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremiah L Birth in court.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Jeremiah L Birth. 
Statutory victim J.B. is present and would like to make a statement. Victim would like no contact dropped. No contact is modified.
Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 10:18 AM- by Zoom) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremiah L Birth appeared by video separately.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen appeared by video for Jeremiah L Birth. 
Defense requests new date. 
Hearing: 07/11/2022 at 9:30 AM.
